 161 -class EntropyRepositoryPlugin(object): 

 162      """ 
 163      This is the base class for implementing EntropyRepository plugin hooks. 
 164      You have to subclass this, implement not implemented methods and provide 
 165      it to EntropyRepository class as described below. 
 166   
 167      Every plugin hook function features this signature: 
 168          int something_hook(entropy_repository_instance) 
 169      Where entropy_repository_instance is the calling EntropyRepository instance. 
 170      Every method should return a return status code which, when nonzero causes 
 171      a RepositoryPluginError exception to be thrown. 
 172      Every method returns 0 in the base class implementation. 
 173      """ 
 174

 184 -    def get_metadata(self): 

 185          """ 
 186          Developers reimplementing EntropyRepositoryPlugin can provide metadata 
 187          along with every instance. 
 188          If you want to provide read-only metadata, this method should really 
 189          return a copy of the metadata object, otherwise, return its direct 
 190          reference. 
 191          Metadata format is a map-like object (dictionary, dict()). 
 192          By default this method does return an empty dict. 
 193          Make sure that your metadata dictionaries around don't have keys in 
 194          common, otherwise those will be randomly overwritten eachothers. 
 195   
 196          @return: plugin metadata 
 197          @rtype: dict 
 198          """ 
 199          return {}

 411 -    def closeDB(self): 

 412          """ 
 413          Close repository storage communication and open disk files. 
 414          You can still use this instance, but closed files will be reopened. 
 415          Attention: call this method from your subclass, otherwise 
 416          EntropyRepositoryPlugins won't be notified of a repo close. 
 417          """ 
 418          if not self.readonly: 
 419              self.commitChanges() 
 420   
 421          plugins = self.get_plugins() 
 422          for plugin_id in sorted(plugins): 
 423              plug_inst = plugins[plugin_id] 
 424              exec_rc = plug_inst.close_repo_hook(self) 
 425              if exec_rc: 
 426                  raise RepositoryPluginError( 
 427                      "[close_repo_hook] %s: status: %s" % ( 
 428                          plug_inst.get_id(), exec_rc,))

 473 -    def filterTreeUpdatesActions(self, actions): 

 474          """ 
 475          This method should be considered internal and not suited for general 
 476          audience. Given a raw package name/slot updates list, it returns 
 477          the action that should be really taken because not applied. 
 478   
 479          @param actions: list of raw treeupdates actions, for example: 
 480              ['move x11-foo/bar app-foo/bar', 'slotmove x11-foo/bar 2 3'] 
 481          @type actions: list 
 482          @return: list of raw treeupdates actions that should be really 
 483              worked out 
 484          @rtype: list 
 485          """ 
 486          new_actions = [] 
 487          for action in actions: 
 488   
 489              if action in new_actions: # skip dupies 
 490                  continue 
 491   
 492              doaction = action.split() 
 493              if doaction[0] == "slotmove": 
 494   
 495                  # slot move 
 496                  atom = doaction[1] 
 497                  from_slot = doaction[2] 
 498                  to_slot = doaction[3] 
 499                  atom_key = entropy.tools.dep_getkey(atom) 
 500                  category = atom_key.split("/")[0] 
 501                  matches, sm_rc = self.atomMatch(atom, matchSlot = from_slot, 
 502                      multiMatch = True) 
 503                  if sm_rc == 1: 
 504                      # nothing found in repo that matches atom 
 505                      # this means that no packages can effectively 
 506                      # reference to it 
 507                      continue 
 508                  found = False 
 509                  # found atoms, check category 
 510                  for package_id in matches: 
 511                      myslot = self.retrieveSlot(package_id) 
 512                      mycategory = self.retrieveCategory(package_id) 
 513                      if mycategory == category: 
 514                          if  (myslot != to_slot) and \ 
 515                          (action not in new_actions): 
 516                              new_actions.append(action) 
 517                              found = True 
 518                              break 
 519                  if found: 
 520                      continue 
 521                  # if we get here it means found == False 
 522                  # search into dependencies 
 523                  dep_atoms = self.searchDependency(atom_key, like = True, 
 524                      multi = True, strings = True) 
 525                  dep_atoms = [x for x in dep_atoms if x.endswith(":"+from_slot) \ 
 526                      and entropy.tools.dep_getkey(x) == atom_key] 
 527                  if dep_atoms: 
 528                      new_actions.append(action) 
 529   
 530              elif doaction[0] == "move": 
 531   
 532                  atom = doaction[1] # usually a key 
 533                  atom_key = entropy.tools.dep_getkey(atom) 
 534                  category = atom_key.split("/")[0] 
 535                  matches, m_rc = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True) 
 536                  if m_rc == 1: 
 537                      # nothing found in repo that matches atom 
 538                      # this means that no packages can effectively 
 539                      # reference to it 
 540                      continue 
 541                  found = False 
 542                  for package_id in matches: 
 543                      mycategory = self.retrieveCategory(package_id) 
 544                      if (mycategory == category) and (action \ 
 545                          not in new_actions): 
 546                          new_actions.append(action) 
 547                          found = True 
 548                          break 
 549                  if found: 
 550                      continue 
 551                  # if we get here it means found == False 
 552                  # search into dependencies 
 553                  dep_atoms = self.searchDependency(atom_key, like = True, 
 554                      multi = True, strings = True) 
 555                  dep_atoms = [x for x in dep_atoms if \ 
 556                      entropy.tools.dep_getkey(x) == atom_key] 
 557                  if dep_atoms: 
 558                      new_actions.append(action) 
 559   
 560          return new_actions

 632 -    def getPackagesToRemove(self, name, category, slot, injected): 

 633          """ 
 634          Return a list of packages that would be removed given name, category, 
 635          slot and injection status. 
 636   
 637          @param name: package name 
 638          @type name: string 
 639          @param category: package category 
 640          @type category: string 
 641          @param slot: package slot 
 642          @type slot: string 
 643          @param injected: injection status (packages marked as injected are 
 644              always considered not automatically removable) 
 645          @type injected: bool 
 646   
 647          @return: list (set) of removable packages (package_ids) 
 648          @rtype: set 
 649          """ 
 650          removelist = set() 
 651          if injected: 
 652              # read: if package has been injected, we'll skip 
 653              # the removal of packages in the same slot, 
 654              # usually used server side btw 
 655              return removelist 
 656   
 657          searchsimilar = self.searchNameCategory( 
 658              name = name, 
 659              category = category, 
 660              sensitive = True 
 661          ) 
 662   
 663          # support for expiration-based packages handling, also internally 
 664          # called Fat Scope. 
 665          filter_similar = False 
 666          srv_ss_plg = etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['server_plugin'] 
 667          srv_ss_fs_plg = \ 
 668              etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['server_plugin_fatscope'] 
 669   
 670          srv_plug_settings = self._settings.get(srv_ss_plg) 
 671          if srv_plug_settings is not None: 
 672              if srv_plug_settings['server']['exp_based_scope']: 
 673                  # in case support is enabled, return an empty set 
 674                  filter_similar = True 
 675   
 676          if filter_similar: 
 677              # filter out packages in the same scope that are allowed to stay 
 678              idpkgs = self._settings[srv_ss_fs_plg]['repos'].get( 
 679                  self.reponame) 
 680              if idpkgs: 
 681                  if -1 in idpkgs: 
 682                      del searchsimilar[:] 
 683                  else:

 685                          not in idpkgs] 
 686   
 687          for atom, package_id in searchsimilar:

 689              myslot = self.retrieveSlot(package_id) 
 690              # we merely ignore packages with

 712          @type pkg_data: dict

 716              provided package identifier, this is very dangerous and could 
 717              cause packages with the same identifier to be removed. 
 718          @type package_id: int 
 719          @keyword do_commit: if True, automatically commits the executed 
 720              transaction (could cause slowness) 
 721          @type do_commit: bool 
 722          @keyword formatted_content: if True, determines whether the content 
 723              metadata (usually the biggest part) in pkg_data is already 
 724              prepared for insertion 
 725          @type formatted_content: bool 
 726          @return: tuple composed by 
 727              - package_id: unique Entropy Repository package identifier 
 728              - revision: final package revision selected 
 729              - pkg_data: new Entropy package metadata dict 
 730          @rtype: tuple 
 731          """ 
 732          plugins = self.get_plugins() 
 733          for plugin_id in sorted(plugins): 
 734              plug_inst = plugins[plugin_id] 
 735              exec_rc = plug_inst.add_package_hook(self, package_id, pkg_data) 
 736              if exec_rc: 
 737                  raise RepositoryPluginError( 
 738                      "[add_package_hook] %s: status: %s" % ( 
 739                          plug_inst.get_id(), exec_rc,))

1560 -    def _runTreeUpdatesMoveAction(self, move_command, quickpkg_queue): 

1561          """ 
1562          Method not suited for general purpose usage. 
1563          Executes package name move action passed. 
1564          No need to override. 
1565   
1566          -- move action: 
1567          1) move package key to the new name: category + name + atom 
1568          2) update all the dependencies in dependenciesreference to the new key 
1569          3) run fixpackages which will update /var/db/pkg files 
1570          4) automatically run quickpkg() to build the new binary and 
1571             tainted binaries owning tainted iddependency and taint database 
1572   
1573          @param move_command: raw treeupdates move action, for example: 
1574              'move x11-foo/bar app-foo/bar' 
1575          @type move_command: string 
1576          @param quickpkg_queue: current package regeneration queue 
1577          @type quickpkg_queue: list 
1578          @return: updated package regeneration queue 
1579          @rtype: list 
1580          """ 
1581          dep_from = move_command[0] 
1582          key_from = entropy.tools.dep_getkey(dep_from) 
1583          key_to = move_command[1] 
1584          cat_to = key_to.split("/")[0] 
1585          name_to = key_to.split("/")[1] 
1586          matches = self.atomMatch(dep_from, multiMatch = True) 
1587          iddependencies = set() 
1588   
1589          for package_id in matches[0]: 
1590   
1591              slot = self.retrieveSlot(package_id) 
1592              old_atom = self.retrieveAtom(package_id) 
1593              new_atom = old_atom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1594   
1595              ### UPDATE DATABASE 
1596              # update category 
1597              self.setCategory(package_id, cat_to) 
1598              # update name 
1599              self.setName(package_id, name_to) 
1600              # update atom 
1601              self.setAtom(package_id, new_atom) 
1602   
1603              # look for packages we need to quickpkg again 
1604              quickpkg_queue.add(key_to+":"+slot) 
1605   
1606              plugins = self.get_plugins() 
1607              for plugin_id in sorted(plugins): 
1608                  plug_inst = plugins[plugin_id] 
1609                  exec_rc = plug_inst.treeupdates_move_action_hook(self, 
1610                      package_id) 
1611                  if exec_rc: 
1612                      raise RepositoryPluginError( 
1613                          "[treeupdates_move_action_hook] %s: status: %s" % ( 
1614                              plug_inst.get_id(), exec_rc,)) 
1615   
1616          iddeps = self.searchDependency(key_from, like = True, multi = True) 
1617          for iddep in iddeps: 
1618              # update string 
1619              mydep = self.getDependency(iddep) 
1620              mydep_key = entropy.tools.dep_getkey(mydep) 
1621              # avoid changing wrong atoms -> dev-python/qscintilla-python would 
1622              # become x11-libs/qscintilla if we don't do this check 
1623              if mydep_key != key_from: 
1624                  continue 
1625              mydep = mydep.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1626              # now update 
1627              # dependstable on server is always re-generated 
1628              self.setDependency(iddep, mydep) 
1629              # we have to repackage also package owning this iddep 
1630              iddependencies |= self.searchPackageIdFromDependencyId(iddep) 
1631   
1632          self.commitChanges() 
1633          quickpkg_queue = list(quickpkg_queue) 
1634          for x in range(len(quickpkg_queue)): 
1635              myatom = quickpkg_queue[x] 
1636              myatom = myatom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1637              quickpkg_queue[x] = myatom 
1638          quickpkg_queue = set(quickpkg_queue) 
1639          for package_id_owner in iddependencies: 
1640              myatom = self.retrieveAtom(package_id_owner) 
1641              myatom = myatom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1642              quickpkg_queue.add(myatom) 
1643          return quickpkg_queue

1677          for package_id in matched_package_ids: 
1678   
1679              ### UPDATE DATABASE 
1680              # update slot 
1681              self.setSlot(package_id, slot_to) 
1682

1684              # note: quickpkg_queue is simply ignored if client_repo == True

1693                  if mydep_key != atomkey: 
1694                      continue 
1695                  if not mydep.endswith(":"+slot_from): # probably slotted dep 
1696                      continue 
1697                  mydep_match = self.atomMatch(mydep) 
1698                  if mydep_match not in matched_package_ids: 
1699                      continue 
1700                  mydep = mydep.replace(":"+slot_from, ":"+slot_to) 
1701                  # now update 
1702                  # dependstable on server is always re-generated 
1703                  self.setDependency(iddep, mydep) 
1704                  # we have to repackage also package owning this iddep 
1705                  iddependencies |= self.searchPackageIdFromDependencyId(iddep) 
1706   
1707              plugins = self.get_plugins() 
1708              for plugin_id in sorted(plugins): 
1709                  plug_inst = plugins[plugin_id] 
1710                  exec_rc = plug_inst.treeupdates_slot_move_action_hook(self, 
1711                      package_id) 
1712                  if exec_rc: 
1713                      raise RepositoryPluginError( 
1714                          "[treeupdates_slot_move_action_hook] %s: status: %s" % ( 
1715                              plug_inst.get_id(), exec_rc,)) 
1716   
1717          self.commitChanges() 
1718          for package_id_owner in iddependencies: 
1719              myatom = self.retrieveAtom(package_id_owner) 
1720              quickpkg_queue.add(myatom)
